sentences.en: a measured response to the problem
sentences.cn: 对问题作出的慎重回应

sentences.en: A ship's speed is measured in knots.
He delivered his words in slow, measured cadences.
sentences.cn: 他讲话缓慢而抑扬顿挫、把握有度。

sentences.en: He measured the rope to see if it was long enough.
sentences.cn: 他量了那根绳子看是否够长.

sentences.en: He measured the speed at which ultrasonic waves travel along the bone.
sentences.cn: 他测出了超声波穿过骨头的速度。

sentences.en: Her more measured response will appeal to voters.
sentences.cn: 她那更为慎重的答复会受到选民的欢迎。

sentences.en: I'd already measured out the ingredients.
She replied in a measured tone to his threat.
sentences.cn: 她以很有分寸的语气回答了他的威胁。
她以不慌不忙的语调说话。

sentences.en: Success should not be measured solely by educational achievement.
sentences.cn: 成功与否不应只用学业成绩来衡量.

sentences.en: Suddenly feeling faint, he measured out his length on the floor.
sentences.cn: 他突然感到头晕, 跌倒在地.

sentences.en: The Egyptians probably measured their day in twenty-four hours of unequal length.
sentences.cn: 埃及人很有可能用不同长度的24小时来度量日子。

sentences.en: The men spoke in soft, measured tones.
sentences.cn: 这些人说话的语气轻柔而平稳。

sentences.en: The packets are measured to reduce waste.
sentences.cn: 包裹的大小经过测量以减少浪费。

sentences.en: The storm measured 10 on the Beaufort scale .
sentences.cn: 这次风暴按蒲福风级测量为10级。

sentences.en: They measured off a half - acre plot for a house lot.
sentences.cn: 他们划出一块半英亩的地皮来作房屋地基.

sentences.en: We measured the dimensions of the kitchen.
sentences.cn: 我们测量了厨房的大小。

words.tran_cn: 可测量的；重要的；重大的
可以测定的程度；可视地
测量；[计量] 度量；尺寸；量度制
[测] 测量器；[测] 测量员
量过的；慎重的；基于标准的；有规则的

trans.tran_cn: 仔细斟酌的，慎重的，缓慢而又有节奏的
trans.tran_en: if you do something in a measured way, you do it in a careful and controlled way, not in an excited or sudden way

trans.tran_cn: 量( measure的过去式和过去分词 )，测量，衡量，量出
